properties.Name: InsuranceStatementLineItemType
properties.Description:
The type of entry made into an Insurance Statement Line Item.

Ex:
- Cash surrender value
- Current death benefit
- Interest credited
- Loans outstanding
- Monthly charges
- Premium paid

CASH SURRENDER VALUE
The amount of cash due an insured who surrenders the insurance policy.

A table of cash surrender values is included in every permanent life insurance policy.

Insurers are required to make cash surrender values available for ordinary whole life insurance after the first three policy years and after five years for industrial life insurance.

Many states allow the insurers to postpone payment of cash surrender values up to six months after policyholders request payment ('delayed payment provision').

Whole life insurance combines insurance protection with a savings or accumulation component known as the cash value of the insurance policy, which builds over the life of the policy.

Whole life insurance plans are credited with a specific guaranteed rate of interest, which is credited to the insurance policy on a regular basis and continues to grow.

The taxation of accumulated values received when a policyholder surrenders a policy is determined by their cost basis. The excess of proceeds over the cost of the policy dividends received, less any policy loan and less extra premiums paid for supplementary benefits.

Endowment policy proceeds, even those left with the company at maturity under an interest-only option, will be partially taxed under the rule of constructive receipt. The taxable amount will be the excess of the proceeds over the premiums paid.

CURRENT DEATH BENEFIT
The current death benefit of the associated Life Insurance policy.

LOANS OUTSTANDING
The value of loans outstanding against the associated Life Insurance policy.

INTEREST CREDITED
A notation regarding the crediting of interest against the associated Life Insurance policy.

MONTHLY CHARGES
A notation regarding monthly charges against the associated Life Insurance policy.

PREMIUM PAID
A notation regarding the payment of a premium against the associated Life Insurance policy.

Columns.Name: StatementLineItemTypeId
Columns.Description:
The unique identifier of an Insurance Statement Line Type.

Ex:

- Premium paid
- Current death benefit
- Interest credited
- Loans outstanding
- Monthly charges
- Cash surrender value

Columns.Name: StatementLineItemTypeName
Columns.Description:
The name of an Insurance Statement Line Type.

Ex:

- Premium paid
- Current death benefit
- Interest credited
- Loans outstanding
- Monthly charges
- Cash surrender value

Columns.Name: StatementLineItemTypeDescription
Columns.Description:
The description of an Insurance Statement Line Type.

Ex:

- Premium paid
- Current death benefit
- Interest credited
- Loans outstanding
- Monthly charges
- Cash surrender value
